trans-unit.source: Gets a thumbnail image from this Image object

seg-source.mrk: Gets a thumbnail image from this Image object

target.mrk: Gets a thumbnail image from this Image object

trans-unit.source: [optional] Width, in pixels, of the requested thumbnail image. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: Width, in pixels, of the requested thumbnail image.

target.mrk: Width, in pixels, of the requested thumbnail image.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Height, in pixels, of the requested thumbnail image. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: Height, in pixels, of the requested thumbnail image.

target.mrk: Height, in pixels, of the requested thumbnail image.

trans-unit.source: [optional] If true destination width and height of the image will be recalculated to keep image aspect ratio. Default is True.

seg-source.mrk: If true destination width and height of the image will be recalculated to keep image aspect ratio.

target.mrk: If true destination width and height of the image will be recalculated to keep image aspect ratio.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Callback function that you provide. During the process of creating or retrieving the thumbnail image, Microsoft Windows GDI+ calls this function to give you the opportunity to abort the process. The default value is NULL.

seg-source.mrk: During the process of creating or retrieving the thumbnail image, Microsoft Windows GDI+ calls this function to give you the opportunity to abort the process.

target.mrk: During the process of creating or retrieving the thumbnail image, Microsoft Windows GDI+ calls this function to give you the opportunity to abort the process.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Pointer to a block of memory that contains data to be used by the callback function. The default value is NULL.

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a block of memory that contains data to be used by the callback function.

target.mrk: Pointer to a block of memory that contains data to be used by the callback function.

trans-unit.source: Handle to an Image object that contains the thumbnail image.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to an Image object that contains the thumbnail image.

target.mrk: Handle to an Image object that contains the thumbnail image.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

trans-unit.source: A thumbnail image is a small copy of an image. Some image files have a thumbnail image embedded in the file. In such cases, this method retrieves the embedded thumbnail image. If there is no embedded thumbnail image, this method creates a thumbnail image by scaling the main image to the size specified in the thumbWidth and thumbHeight parameters. If both of those parameters are 0, a system-defined size is used.

seg-source.mrk: A thumbnail image is a small copy of an image.
Some image files have a thumbnail image embedded in the file.
In such cases, this method retrieves the embedded thumbnail image.
If there is no embedded thumbnail image, this method creates a thumbnail image by scaling the main image to the size specified in the thumbWidth and thumbHeight parameters.
If both of those parameters are 0, a system-defined size is used.

target.mrk: A thumbnail image is a small copy of an image.
Some image files have a thumbnail image embedded in the file.
In such cases, this method retrieves the embedded thumbnail image.
If there is no embedded thumbnail image, this method creates a thumbnail image by scaling the main image to the size specified in the thumbWidth and thumbHeight parameters.
If both of those parameters are 0, a system-defined size is used.

trans-unit.source: Don't forget to dispose the thumbnail imgage using _GDIPlus_ImageDispose().

seg-source.mrk: Don't forget to dispose the thumbnail imgage using _GDIPlus_ImageDispose().

target.mrk: Don't forget to dispose the thumbnail imgage using _GDIPlus_ImageDispose().

trans-unit.source: No image file has been selected

seg-source.mrk: No image file has been selected

target.mrk: No image file has been selected

trans-unit.source: This file isn't supported by GDIPlus!

seg-source.mrk: This file isn't supported by GDIPlus!

target.mrk: This file isn't supported by GDIPlus!
